scenes.heading: INT. DANIEL’S HOUSE - BASEMENT - DAY

dialogues.text: In Herman Eustis’ seminal work on the joys of being a model train hobbyist, he writes:

For the model train enthusiast, there exists a secret world of order and symmetry. Nestled into the corners of our basements and attics, we lord over a world where the hobbyist plays omnipotent creator. There, in 1:87 scale, the neighbors are always kind, the lovers always end up together, and the trains always take you to the far off places you always swore you’d go.”
In life, of course, nothing is nearly as neat and tidy.
